body:
### Problem

When running `zig build nvim` on Windows, the build fails due to the generated `nlua0.exe` exiting with a non-zero exit code.

### Steps to reproduce

```sh
git clone https://github.com/neovim/neovim
cd neovim
zig build nvim
```

### Expected behavior

Build should succeed.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.12.0-dev commit bc0635a9fc9c15a2423d4eb35f627d127d00fa46

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Windows 11 25H2 (OS Build 26200.7171)

### Terminal name/version

Windows Terminal

### $TERM environment variable

N/A

### Installation

Build from repo

comment_data.body:
The executable fails for empty scripts as well:

```ps1
New-Item -Path .\script.lua # Empty file
zig build nlua0 -- .\script.lua
```
```
nlua0
â””â”€ run exe nlua0 failure
error: the following command exited with error code 53:
".\\.zig-cache\\o\\7694bf674156bed95a58893a09b4e7fd\\nlua0.exe" ".\\script.lua"

Build Summary: 13/15 steps succeeded; 1 failed
nlua0 transitive failure
â””â”€ run exe nlua0 failure

error: the following build command failed with exit code 1:
.zig-cache\o\1395e3e3b70a66648dbf723a259252ba\build.exe C:\Users\eamonburns\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WinGet\Packages\zig.zig_Microsoft.Winget.Source_8wekyb3d8bbwe\zig-x86_64-windows-0.15.2\zig.exe C:\Users\eamonburns\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WinGet\Packages\zig.zig_Microsoft.Winget.Source_8wekyb3d8bbwe\zig-x86_64-windows-0.15.2\lib C:\Users\eamonburns\projects\external\neovim.clean .zig-cache C:\Users\eamonburns\AppData\Local\zig --seed 0xdf92d755 -Ze7317915c14f0d1b nlua0 -- .\script.lua
```

This is most likely because you need to compile with the luajit option set to true.

Edit: try `zig build nvim -Dluajit=true`

Also try `zig build nlua0  -Dluajit=true -- .\script.lua`

@crwebb85 Hm, same error:

```
zig build nlua0 -Dluajit=true -- .\script.lua
```
```
        1 file(s) copied.
nlua0
â””â”€ run exe nlua0 failure
error: the following command exited with error code 53:
".\\.zig-cache\\o\\71dfe195be51fc55916ac33fb625898c\\nlua0.exe" ".\\script.lua"

Build Summary: 24/26 steps succeeded; 1 failed
nlua0 transitive failure
â””â”€ run exe nlua0 failure

error: the following build command failed with exit code 1:
.zig-cache\o\7b302df6e410afb3dcd077b7c67186a9\build.exe C:\Users\eamonburns\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WinGet\Packages\zig.zig_Microsoft.Winget.Source_8wekyb3d8bbwe\zig-x86_64-windows-0.15.2\zig.exe C:\Users\eamonburns\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WinGet\Packages\zig.zig_Microsoft.Winget.Source_8wekyb3d8bbwe\zig-x86_64-windows-0.15.2\lib C:\Users\eamonburns\projects\external\neovim .zig-cache C:\Users\eamonburns\AppData\Local\zig --seed 0xcd200ecf -Zdcec618d99fd4d5f nlua0 -Dluajit=true -- .\script.lua
```

Looks like the only difference is when `-Dluajit` is set, there is the following line:

```
        1 file(s) copied.
```

Just to make sure what version of zig are you using? The build requires a specific version. Given that the build gets as far as it does, I expect you have the correct version, but it's worth checking.
@crwebb85 `zig version` reports `0.15.2`. I am also not using a Zig version manager, just the one installed using WinGet
Yeah, that's the correct version. I know it was working for me on this commit 64cf63a88110459d70d140f6074fa014adaef331 3 days ago, so something might have changed since then
I checked out that commit, and it didn't work for that one either. I'm going to try to git bisect
Try clearing the zig cache (both global and local), there is a suss caching issue affecting windows-zig build on CI now and then (and the fix is nuking the cache:p).

@bfredl I nuked the cache and I am still getting the error :\

```ps1
rm -Recurse C:\Users\erburns\AppData\Local\zig
rm -Recurse .zig-cache
zig build nlua0 -- .\script.lua
```
Also, unfortunately I wasn't able to find the commit where it started due to every other commit failing due to other issues ðŸ«¤

> @bfredl I nuked the cache and I am still getting the error :\
> 
> ```ps1
> rm -Recurse C:\Users\erburns\AppData\Local\zig
> rm -Recurse .zig-cache
> zig build nlua0 -- .\script.lua
> ```

Nuke the cache and then do `zig build nvim -Dluajit=true` instead of doing nlua0

> zig build nlua0 -Dluajit=true -- .\script.lua

No do `zig build nvim -Dluajit=true` not nlua0.

@crwebb85 Same issue. The `nvim` step depends on `nlua0`. You have to be able to run `nlua0.exe` to generate some files that `nvim.exe` uses.

```
rm -Recurse C:\Users\erburns\AppData\Local\zig\,.\.zig-cache\
zig build nvim -Dluajit=true
```

nvim
â””â”€ install nvim
   â””â”€ compile exe nvim Debug native

         â””â”€ run exe nlua0 (move.c.generated.h) failure
error: stderr:

<and so on for a whole bunch of other steps>
```

Okay I retested this on the following commits
- current master branch: 3a70fc8cb8fedf78b5e0d7c606d99967faad70ab 
- the commit you were testing: bc0635a9fc 
- the commit I was testing a few days ago: 64cf63a881

On each commit I tried the following commands:
```powershell
zig build nlua0 -- script.lua
zig build nlua0 -Dluajit=true -- script.lua
zig build nvim
zig build nvim -Dluajit=true 
```
Each command ran without error on all three commits, and I took care to delete the zig-cache 
and zig-out folder after each command.

script.lua
```lua
print('helloworld')
```

running `zig build nlua0 -- script.lua` would output
```powershell
helloworld
```

My System Information:
OS Name	Microsoft Windows 11 Pro
Version	10.0.26100 Build 26100
System Type	x64-based PC

Zig version (downloaded from https://ziglang.org/download/):
```powershell
>zig version  
0.15.2
```

Edit: I got a new laptop that I haven't setup yet. I might later try just downloading zig on it and seeing if the commands run correctly on it.

Edit2: Also apparently my memory of needing to us ` -Dluajit=true` when building was incorrect. It was only required to run my neovim config since lazy.nvim requires luajit for some reason.

> I got a new laptop that I haven't setup yet. I might later try just downloading zig on it and seeing if the commands run correctly on it.

I was able to replicate the issue on the new laptop.

My System Information:
OS Name Microsoft Windows 11 Pro
Version 10.0.26200 Build 26200
System Type x64-based PC

I tested it immediantly after setting up Windows 11 before installing anything (not even git) other than zig. I downloaded zig from the release page and downloaded the neovim repository as a zip file and that's it. I'll need to do some more testing to identify the cause but I suspect there must be some dependency expected on the system that isn't downloaded by the zig build.

> I was able to replicate the issue on the new laptop.

I'm not crazy! Thank you ðŸ¤£

@crwebb85 

My system information:  
- OS Name: Microsoft Windows 11 Business
- Version: 10.0.26200 Build 26200
- System Type: x64-based PC

It looks like we have the same version and build. And your other computer has an older version (Version 10.0.26100 Build 26100)

Would you be able to check if you have updates pending on your other computer to see if it affects that one too?

> Would you be able to check if you have updates pending on your other computer to see if it affects that one too?

I updated my desktop to `Version	10.0.26200 Build 26200` and tested commit 2ad53b8a190925dc78abdeeb48bfea2176f1315e (current master) with `zig build  nlua0 --script.lua` but it runs successfully. I tested that commit on my laptop and it still errors.

Okay I finally found the solution. I had to install Windows SDK https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/downloads/windows-sdk/ to make it work. Previously on my desktop, I had it installed alongside Visual Studio but after uninstalling Visual Studio I could no longer run `zig build nlua0 --script.lua` and the following error popup appeared. I never saw this popup on my laptop when the command would error there so definitely some unanswered questions on that front. However, googling the missing dll indicated that Windows SDK may be required. After reinstalling Windows SDK (this time using the Windows SDK installer rather than with Visual Studio), clearing the cache, and restarting my desktop, I was able to succcessfully run `zig build nlua0 --script.lua`. I was also able to repeat this on my laptop and successfully run `zig build nlua0 --script.lua`. I want to do some more experiments but this should get you up and running. Im curious if the nlua0 built without Windows SDK installed can run correctly on a machine with it. If so then the SDK is probably a runtime dependency rather than a build dependency. Side note: I figured all this out because I started uninstalling programs to try and fix an issue with node. I was uninstalling/reinstalling a bunch of programs and figured I should test the zig build between each program I uninstalled/ installed.
@crwebb85 Thank you! The computer I am having issues on is my work laptop, so I won't be able to verify this until Monday.

I installed the [Windows SDK](https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/downloads/windows-sdk/) and after that, the ~~build succeeded~~! (it failed for other reasons ðŸ«¤, but `nlua0` succeeded)

I didn't have to clear the cache, so I think that might mean that it is a runtime dependency.

I am wondering if this is an issue with Zig itself, or an issue with the `build.zig`.

I can now successfully build using Zig after https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/37111.

I am thinking of keeping this issue open though, because I would like to figure out the reason why Windows SDK is required for `zig build`, but not the CMake build.

labels.description: building and installing Neovim using the provided scripts
labels.name: build

title: `zig build nvim` fails on Windows (nlua0 exit code 53)
